data.title: Service & Food compliment one another.
data.text:
Always a pleasing experience. Authentic ethnic taste that makes one crave for more.
Icing on the cake....great selection of Indian Beers.

data.title: I love it!
data.text: I like to come here all the time, especially during the buffet time. There's a variety of food that fills you up and it tastes fantastic! I definitely recommend this place if you want good Indian food.

data.title: Totally recommend!
data.text: My friends and I come here all the time. The food is great! I really love the south Indian style food and they make the food spicier for me.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: Had a meal here but was very disappointed. I love well flavoured Indian food but this was very mediocre. The rosemary nam was lovely.

data.title: Great atmosphere and service
data.text:
Excellent service and great food!
The veg thali was amazing and the cheese naan was delicious 
Relaxing and friendly atmosphere for the family

data.title: Excellent!!!
data.text: Walk 50' off the main strip and treat yourself to outstanding Indian cuisine.  The buffet has a wide assortment of incredible dishes.  Everything is clean, the authentic Indian music TV really sets the atmosphere, and the staff is super friendly.  We will go here every time we visit Greenville!

data.title: Sada Karela was wonderful!
data.text: These guys made my favorite Indian dish! The owner went all the way to Raleigh to buy the bitter melon. They also made Idli which should be on the buffet :) Thanks again!!!

data.title: Great food
data.text: Excellent food. Loved the chicken tiki marsala and how spicy it was. Service was great as well. Will be back.

data.title: Incredibly Disappointing
data.text: After reading rave reviews just about everywhere online (how is this restaurant #1 on TripAdvisor?!), we went to Cinnamon for the lunch buffet. While we didn’t try anything off the regular menu, our experience was underwhelming, to say the least. They offered a decent variety of dishes to try, but none were exceptional. The mango dessert and Tandoori Chicken were tasty. The naan, however, was dense and rubbery…quite unpleasant. After trying the regular naan, we ordered the garlic naan which was very thin and had a bitter note…perhaps from the garlic? Also unpleasant. Neither were what you would expect of the traditional, airy, fluffy naan. The vegetable korma was tasty but not what a traditional korma is supposed to be like. The Chicken Makhani looked delicious but was quite bland and lacking flavor. I am hopeful that the regular menu has better quality dishes than the buffet but we definitely won’t be going back to see.

owner_response.author: Tirath S, Manager at Cinnamon, responded to this review
owner_response.text: First, we want to thank you for trying our food, even though you have no experience about the indian food. So you talked about the naan in this review, even you loaded your plate with at least 20 pieces of naan and then order the garlic naan also. By having too much of naan, how did you able to try other food from the buffet? For your information, every restaurant has their own specialities and tastes. For you only, we cannot change our spicy level and dishes.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Food is delicous
data.text: You can order spicy or mild. Great service also. This is true authentic Indian cuisine. The staff will help you choose a food to your liking if you wish.

data.title: Excellent Indian Food
data.text: We order lunch from there quite frequently and are never disappointed...excellent food!! If you have not tried Indian food before and try the buttery chicken, rice and veggies...really good!!!

data.title: Best Indian Cuisine
data.text: Best indian cuisine in Greenville, NC. Excellent service,Clean environment,Authentic Northern Indian Food and very friendly and smiley face to greet you always

data.title: Great Food
data.text: I come here often for their lunch buffet and its amazing.  I can't really single one item out because everything I have had here is really good.  They offer student discounts at lunch which is nice.

data.title: Consistently High Quality
data.text:
Visited here on business, have been here a number of times and it's actually the restaurant that helped me fall in love with Indian cuisine, haha!

Staff is friendly and efficient, you don't have to ask them to refill your water/tea/etc., which is the way it should be (chain restaurant servers, take notices). The food is delicious and the naan bread is to die for.

If you aren't familiar with Indian cuisine, you may want to check out Cinnamon at lunchtime. 

Their buffet offers a nice variety of dishes that are really savory but NOT spicy (as many people perceive all Indian cuisine to be very hot and spicy). 

And now that the parking deck is open around the corner, it's much easier to visit Cinnamon and the rest of uptown Greenville anyway!

data.title: Best Indian Food in town
data.text: Man this place is great! They have an all you can eat buffet and it's only $7 with a student ID. I always eat here and I will continue to do so while I am in Greenville, NC.

data.title: Amazing Food
data.text: Not much I can say, but it is a GREAT place to get Indian food. They have a great buffet and they deliver. If you are ever in the Greenville, NC area, Cinnamon should be on your list.

data.title: Good Indian food
data.text: Decent Indian food on a moderate budget. Location isn't great, as it's downtown, but worth the trip. The Sunday brunch is great as it includes mimosas.

data.title: Reliable, very good, Indian buffet
data.text:
Reliably and consistently tasty, basic Indian buffet.
Inexpensive but not much in the way of frills.
Busy with college crowd - staff/professors and students at lunchtime.
We have only had buffet at lunchtime. Not sure if other menu choices are available at that time.

data.title: Best Indian food in town
data.text: By far the best in town. The restaurant is clean and the food is fresh and authentic. We will be back very soon.

data.title: The best Indian food in Greenville, North Carolina
data.text: I've been eating here since it was called Dales Indian Restaurant. It's my husbands favorite Indian restaurant and with good reason! The food is very well prepared, with fresh ingredients and the buffet is never the same way twice! We've taken many of our friends here and we keep coming back ourselves!
